org.jWebSocket.api
Interface WebSocketConnector

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseConnector
public interface WebSocketConnector

Specifies the API for web socket connectors. Connectors are the low level link to the client. Connectors are maintained by the engine only but can be accessed up to the application. Each connector provides a map for shared custom variables (public) which can be used in all overlying tiers.

Method Detail

startConnector

void startConnector()
Starts and initializes the connector. Usually a connector is implemented as as thread which waits on incoming data. The listener thread should implement a timeout to close a connection after a configurable time of inactivity on the connection. Further the connectorStarted method of the overlying engine is called if the connector successfully started.

stopConnector

void stopConnector()
Stops and cleans up the connector. Usually here the listener thread for this connection is stopped. Further the connectorStopped method of the overlying engine is called if the connector successfully started.

processPacket

void processPacket(WebSocketPaket aDataPacket)
Processes an incoming datapacket from a WebSocket client. Usually the data packet is not processed in any way but only passed up to the processPacket method of the overlying engine.

Parameters:
aDataPacket - raw web socket data packet

sendPacket

void sendPacket(WebSocketPaket aDataPacket)
Sends a datapacket to a WebSocket client. Here the packet is finally passed to client via the web socket connection.

Parameters:
aDataPacket - raw web socket data packet

getHeader

RequestHeader getHeader()
Returns the request header from the client during the connection establishment. In the request header all fields of the client request and its URL parameters are stored.

Returns:
RequestHeader object

setHeader

void setHeader(RequestHeader aHeader)
Sets the request header. This methode is called after the hand shake of the web socket protocol has been accomplished and all data of the request header is known.

Parameters:
aHeader - RequestHeader object

getVar

java.lang.Object getVar(java.lang.String aKey)
Returns the given custom variable as an Object. Custom variables in a connector are public and can be shared over all modules of an application.

Parameters:
aKey - Name of the shared custom variable
Returns:
Object

setVar

void setVar(java.lang.String aKey,
            java.lang.Object aValue)
Set the given custom variable to the passed value. Custom variables in a connector are public and can be shared over all modules of an application.

Parameters:
aKey - Name of the shared custom variable
aValue - Object

getBoolean

java.lang.Boolean getBoolean(java.lang.String aKey)
Returns the boolean object of the passed variable or null if the variable does not exist.

Parameters:
aKey - Name of the shared custom variable
Returns:
Boolean object

getBool

boolean getBool(java.lang.String aKey)
Returns the boolean value of the passed variable. If the variable does not exist always false is returned.

Parameters:
aKey - Name of the shared custom variable
Returns:
boolean value (simple type, not an Object)

setBoolean

void setBoolean(java.lang.String aKey,
                java.lang.Boolean aValue)
Sets the boolean value of the given shared custom variable.

Parameters:
aKey - Name of the shared custom variable
aValue - Boolean value

getString

java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String aKey)
Returns the string object of the passed variable or null if the variable does not exist. The default character encoding is applied.

Parameters:
aKey - Name of the shared custom variable
Returns:
String

setString

void setString(java.lang.String aKey,
               java.lang.String aValue)
Sets the string value of the given shared custom variable.

Parameters:

aValue - String

Returns the integer object of the passed variable or null if the variable does not exist.

Parameters:

Integer object

setInteger

                java.lang.Integer aValue)
Sets the integer value of the given shared custom variable.

Parameters:
aKey - Name of the shared custom variable
aValue - Integer value

removeVar

void removeVar(java.lang.String aKey)
Removes the given shared custom variable from the connector. After this operation the variable is not accessible anymore.

Parameters:
aKey - Name of the shared custom variable

generateUID

java.lang.String generateUID()
Generates a unique ID for this connector to be used to calculate a session ID in overlying tiers.

Returns:
a unique ID for this connector

getRemotePort

int getRemotePort()
Returns the remote port of the connected client.

Returns:

getRemoteHost

java.net.InetAddress getRemoteHost()
Returns the IP number of the connected remote host.

Returns:
InetAddress object of the given remote host
